title: Sime Darby and Brunsfield exit Serenity Cove project for $50m
text:
Malaysian developer giants Sime Darby and Brunsfield have sold their masterplanned community site Serenity Cove on the Gold Coast to Brisbane developer Keylin Group for $50 million.

The sale marks Sime Darby's departure from the Australian property market as it undertakes a global strategy to sell non-core assets from places such as Singapore, Vietnam and Australia.

One of the many projects on Hope Island, the Aniko project at 1 Grant Avenue. Supplied

Aside from the Serenity Cove site in the Hope Island and Helensvale areas, about 50 kilometres south of Brisbane, the group has also sold two smaller hospitality assets including one in Margaret River some time ago.

The 65-hectare waterfront Serenity Cove was earmarked for a $650 million masterplanned housing community which has an approval for 350 new homes.

An extension of the Oyster Cove community, the project sits along Saltwater Creek, which feeds into the Coomera River and the broader Hope Island marine and leisure precinct.
description: The sale marks Malaysian juggernaut Sime Darby's departure from the Australian property market.
